alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 4:31AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Slippery Travel Still Possible This Morning... .Confidence has decreased for widespread ice accumulations across the county as overnight temperatures have held steady just above freezing by a degree or two. However, cannot rule out a light glaze of ice in the far north-northeast portion of the county where temperatures remain near freezing. A difference in temperatures by a couple degrees would have big implications on total icing accumulations. Check road conditions before heading out this morning. Although icing amounts may be minor, untreated roads and sidewalks would be slippery for the morning commute. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain. Ice accumulations of a light glaze up to one tenth of an inch for the far northeast portion of the county. * WHERE...Taylor County. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The slippery conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
